**Professionnel Mental Health Training and Supervision Services**

# Tender Details
**Solicitation Number**: 21301-23-4495991
**Publication Date**: January 12, 2024
**Closing Date**: February 7, 2024, 14:00:00 EST
**Contract Period**: From April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, with the option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods

**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Description**
The Correctional Service of Canada requires professional training and supervision services in mental health for staff in all institutions and communities in the Quebec Region. The contractor must provide training and supervision on the integrative approach based on Doctor Livesley’s model.

**Deliverables**: The contractor must provide virtual training and supervision online on the Microsoft Teams platform or in person when authorized.

**Security Requirements**: This contract includes security requirements.

**Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), World Trade Organisation-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Canada Ukraine Free-Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada Korea Trade Agreement (CKTA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

**Procurement Strategy**: Competitive Procurement Strategy - lowest priced compliant bid.

**Eligibility**: All interested suppliers can submit a bid. This procurement is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers.

**Evaluation Criteria**: The evaluation criteria will be based on the lowest price.

# Tender Information
**Contact Information**: Francine Marcotte, (343) 598-9309, Francine.Marcotte@CSC-SCC.gc.ca

**Notice and Documents**: The notice and documents can be downloaded from Canada buys / tender opportunities website.

**Language of Tender**: The documents can be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).

Note:
This record represents the intention of the Correctional Service of Canada to conclude an agreement for professional mental health training and supervision services.
